hanzi-su-wiki:
並

Значения

Средний, обычный; выстраивать, сравнивать

Мнемоника

Искажено. Совмещение двух элементов «молодой человек» 立, выбирать наиболее достойного.

Варианты

竝, 并, 傡

heisig_chinese_memo: Two people standing side by side in a row.
heisig_story: This character represents a slightly stylized duplication of the kanji for stand up. By lengthening the sixth and seventh strokes, you will see how this is done.
Keyword_KKLC: LINE UP, place in a row; average, ordinary
Keyword_KKLC_ru: выстраиваются в очередь, место в строке; средний, обычный
Keyword_KANJIDIC: row, and, besides, as well as, line up, rank with, rival, equal
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: ряд, и, кроме того, так же как, выстраиваются в очередь, ранг с, соперник, равный
koohiiStory1: This is a simplification of 竝, a ideogram of two people standing in a row.
koohiiStory2: Hint : as a primitive I use the image of a rowing boat. In a rowing boat people sit in rows, but also side-by-side (another meaning of the kanji), working together (yet another meaning of this kanji). Note : there will also be a kanji for "rowboat" coming at frame 1876. The rowing boat is associated with the sport, and is a primitive, while the kanji for "rowboat" has a generic meaning of "a small boat". In any case, the kanji for "rowboat" will not appear as a primitive in the book.
kunYomi: な.み、なら.べる、なら.ぶ、なら.びに
jp_example_words:
月並み(つきなみ): every month, common
並み(なみ): average, medium, common, ordinary
並びに(ならびに): and
軒並み(のきなみ): row of houses
並列(へいれつ): arrangement, parallel, abreast
並木(なみき): roadside tree, row of trees
並行(へいこう): (going) side by side, concurrent, abreast, at the same time, occurring together, parallel, parallelism
並ぶ(ならぶ): line up, stand in a line
並べる(ならべる): line up, set up
jp_readingExamples: 並 (なみ), 並びに (なら.びに), 並ぶ (なら.ぶ), 並べる (なら.べる)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You stick horns in the ground using them as spikes and you line up the horns in a straight line. Horns are pretty much the same thing as spikes once you stick them in the ground, and you line these ones up precisely for optimal protection.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine yourself lining up these horns in the ground. The spikes are sharp and you poke yourself with one. Ouch. Need to be more careful as you line these up.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As you line up these horns and stick them into the ground, you notice a bull munching on hay (へい) nearby. It's staring at the horns you're lining up. Somehow it feels like it's munching that hay angrily. You gulp, looking at its horn as it grabs another mouthful of hay, and you feel pretty guilty.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine the hay in that bull's mouth as it chomps angrily, watching you line up horns in the ground. It probably wishes you were the hay.
Ru_Meaning: row, and, besides, as well as, line up, rank with, rival, equal
Ru_trainchinese: bìng: (глаг/нареч/союз) стоять бок о бок; бок о бок, вместе, одновременно; (используется перед отрицанием) совсем, отнюдь; (используется между глаголами или глагольными фразами) и, а также
Kanshudo_mnemonic: two standing (立) people are lined up
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Combine the grip you get from  both horns so you can ride the bull.
humanum_full_description_en:
Jia Jinwen from the second " big " or " stand ", like two people standing side by side on the ground. The original meaning is juxtaposition.

Din considered ancient " and ", " and " the same word, press the A Bronze " and ", " and " shape, Jie do not use, do not mix later books, see the " and ."

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the names of people and places, and also mean Bin Ye (Xu Zhongshu). The inscriptions on gold mean side by side and together, Zhongshan Wang Fanghu: "will stand alongside (and) my Lord in the world." It is also used as a person's name and family name.

" And " Xiaozhuan for " and " with A. Clementi same shape, but also for allogeneic " 𡘋 '," said the text ":".. And, and also from the two standing and who are all from and. "
humanum_short_description_en: Two people standing side by side on the ground. The original meaning is juxtaposition.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文從二「大」或「立」，象兩人並排正面站立在地上之形。本義是並立。

　　丁山認為古「並」、「并」同字，按甲金文「並」、「并」字形、用法皆有別，後世典籍混用無別，參見「并」。

　　甲骨文用作人名、地名，又表示併也(徐中舒)。金文表示並排、共同，中山王方壺：「將與吾君竝(並)立於世」。又用作人名、族氏名。

　　「並」小篆作「竝」，與甲金文同形，異體又作「𡘋」，《說文》：「竝，併也。从二立。凡竝之屬皆从竝。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文象兩人並排，正面站立在地上。本義是並立。

並 (Simplified: 并)
Pinyin: bìng
English Definition: and; furthermore; also; together with; (not) at all; simultaneously; to combine; to join; to merge
Total strokes: 8; Radical: 一
Ideographic: Two people sitting side-by-side; compare 竝
Character Formation:
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 丷 [ ha ] kwukyel
    • 亚 [ yà ] Asia; second
Example Words:

並非 [ bìng fēi ]: really isn't
並舉 [ bìng jǔ ]: to develop simultaneously; to undertake concurrently
More: 並* | *並 | *並*
heisig_comment: * The primitive meaning remains the same as that of the kanji, but special attention has to be given to the varieties of shape this element can undergo. It is the most difficult one you will meet in this book. When it appears BENEATH its relative primitive, the top three strokes are omitted, though the third horizontal stroke may be doubled up with the bottom horizontal stroke of the element above it. ATOP its relative primitive, it can keep its kanji shape. When it does not, the top three strokes are removed and all of them are replaced BELOW the primitive's bottom line. We shall acknowledge this latter transformation by changing its meaning to upside down in a row.

  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 丷 [ ha ] kwukyel
    • 亚 [ yà ] Asia; second
①合在一起：併攏。合併。兼併。
②一齊，平排着：並駕齊驅。並重(zhòng)。並行(xíng)。
③連詞，表平列或進一層：並且。
④用在否定詞前，加強否定的語氣，表不像預料的那樣：並不容易。

Heisig: This character represents a slightly stylized duplication of the kanji for stand up. By lengthening the sixth and seventh strokes, you will see how this is done.
* The primitive meaning remains the same as that of the kanji, but special attention has to be given to the varieties of shape this element can undergo. It is the most difficult one you will meet in this book. When it appears BENEATH its relative primitive, the top three strokes are omitted, though the third horizontal stroke may be doubled up with the bottom horizontal stroke of the element above it. ATOP its relative primitive, it can keep its kanji shape. When it does not, the top three strokes are removed and all of them are replaced BELOW the primitive's bottom line. We shall acknowledge this latter transformation by changing its meaning to upside down in a row.
Chinese: Two people standing side by side in a row.

In a rowing boat people sit in rows, but also side-by-side (another meaning of the kanji), working together (yet another meaning of this kanji). Note : there will also be a kanji for "rowboat" coming at frame 1876. The rowing boat is associated with the sport, and is a primitive, while the kanji for "rowboat" has a generic meaning of "a small boat". In any case, the kanji for "rowboat" will not appear as a primitive in the book.

甲金文從二「 大 」或「 立 」，象兩人並排正面站立在地上之形。本義是並立。 丁山認為古「 並 」、「 并 」同字，按甲金文「 並 」、「 并 」字形、用法皆有別，後世典籍混用無別，參見「 并 」。 甲骨文用作人名、地名，又表示併也(徐中舒)。金文表示並排、共同，中山王方壺：「將與吾君竝(並)立於世」。又用作人名、族氏名。 「 並 」小篆作「 竝 」，與甲金文同形，異體又作「 𡘋 」，《說文》：「竝，併也。从二立。凡竝之屬皆从竝。」
Jia Jinwen from the second " big" or " stand", like two people standing side by side on the ground. The original meaning is juxtaposition. Din considered ancient " and", " and" the same word, press the A Bronze " and", " and" shape, Jie do not use, do not mix later books, see the " and." The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the names of people and places, and also mean Bin Ye (Xu Zhongshu). The inscriptions on gold mean side by side and together, Zhongshan Wang Fanghu: "will stand alongside (and) my Lord in the world." It is also used as a person's name and family name. " And" Xiaozhuan for " and" with A. Clementi same shape, but also for allogeneic " 𡘋 '," said the text ":".. And, and also from the two standing and who are all from and. "

並字的基本解释

並
bìng
同“并”。

並字的汉语字典释义

[①]［bìng］
［《廣韻》蒲迥切，上迥，並。］
亦作“傡1”。“竝1”的今字。
(1)平列。
(2)兼有；具有。
(3)皆是；都是。
(4)比并；相比。
(5)合并。
(6)指吞并。
(7)聚合；凑合。
(8)犹拼，，谓舍命相斗。
(9)似；如。
(10)副词。普遍；全都。
(11)副词。一起；一同。
(12)副词。用在否定词前面加强否定的语气。
(13)副词。犹甚至、连。常与“亦”连用，后多跟否定词，强调程度之深。
(14)而且；并且。
(15)表示两个动作同时进行。
(16)犹和，与。
[②]［bàng］
［《集韻》蒲浪切，去宕，並。］
亦作“傡2”。通“傍2”。
(1)挨着。
(2)依随。参见“並2世”。
(3)旁边。

並字的康熙字典解释

【子集上】【一字部】　並； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页78第14
【集韻】竝，隷作並。

並字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
並字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［bìng］
["Guangyun" Pu Jiong cut, Shang Jiong, combined. ]
Also known as "傡1". The present character of "Ban 1".
(1) Parallel.
(2) Both; have.
(3) Both; both.
(4) Compare and compare;
(5) Merger.
(6) Refers to annexation.
(7) Aggregation; improvised.
(8) Still fighting, it is said that fighting with one's life.
(9) Like; such.
(10) Adverbs. Universal; all.
(11) Adverbs. Together
(12) Adverbs. Used in front of negative words to strengthen the negative tone.
(13) Adverbs. Still even, even. It is often used in conjunction with "yi", followed by negative words to emphasize the depth of the degree.
(14) And; and.
(15) means that two actions are performed at the same time.
(16) Juhe, and.
[②]［bàng］
["Ji Yun" Pu Lang cuts, goes down, and merges. ]
Also known as "傡2". Same as "Pong 2".
(1) Next to each other.
(2) Follow along. See "Union 2 Worlds".
(3) Next to it.

Name meaning

bìng, bīng
вм. 并
Radicals: 一  (ground, horns, spikes)
Meaning Mnemonic
You stick horns in the ground using them as spikes and you line up the horns in a straight line. Horns are pretty much the same thing as spikes once you stick them in the ground, and you line these ones up precisely for optimal protection.
Imagine yourself lining up these horns in the ground. The spikes are sharp and you poke yourself with one. Ouch. Need to be more careful as you line these up.
Reading Mnemonic
As you line up these horns and stick them into the ground, you notice a bull munching on hay (へい) nearby. It's staring at the horns you're lining up. Somehow it feels like it's munching that hay angrily. You gulp, looking at its horn as it grabs another mouthful of hay, and you feel pretty guilty.
Imagine the hay in that bull's mouth as it chomps angrily, watching you line up horns in the ground. It probably wishes you were the hay.
